results.title: ‘King Richard’ Review: Father Holds Court
results.abstract: Will Smith and Aunjanue Ellis play the parents of Venus and Serena Williams in a warm, exuberant, old-fashioned sports drama.

multimedia.caption: From left, Demi Singleton as Serena, Saniyya Sidney as Venus and Will Smith as the future tennis stars’ father, Richard Williams, in “King Richard.”

results.title: ‘Ghostbusters: Afterlife’ Review: A Play for Nostalgia and Merch
results.abstract: Jason Reitman, son of the original “Ghostbusters” director, delivers a toothless film with Paul Rudd as a love interest and plenty of cutesy ghosts.

multimedia.caption: In “Ghostbusters: Afterlife,” the main characters are adorable, wide-eyed children, played by, from left, Celeste O’Connor, Finn Wolfhard, Logan Kim and Mckenna Grace.

results.title: Jamie Dornan Goes Back to ‘Belfast,’ but Not Without Worry
results.abstract: This Oscar contending drama takes Dornan from “Fifty Shades of Grey” into prestige filmmaking, though many things about the film hit awfully close to home.

multimedia.caption: “I’m more ambitious than I’ve ever let on before,” Jamie Dornan said.
multimedia.copyright: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

results.title: ‘C’mon C’mon’ Review: Are You My Mommy?
results.abstract: In Mike Mills’s latest film, Joaquin Phoenix plays an uncle who takes care of his precocious nephew during a family crisis.

multimedia.caption: Bonding: Joaquin Phoenix and Woody Norman in Mike Mills’s “C’mon C’mon.”

results.title: ‘Tick, Tick … Boom!’ Review: A Bohemian’s Rhapsodies
results.abstract: Andrew Garfield stars as Jonathan Larson, the composer and lyricist of “Rent,” in this meta-musical directed by Lin-Manuel Miranda.

multimedia.caption: Andrew Garfield as Jonathan Larson in “Tick, Tick … Boom!”

results.title: ‘Bad Luck Banging or Loony Porn’ Review: No Sex, Please, We’re Romanian
results.abstract: A viral video scandal ensnares a Bucharest schoolteacher in Radu Jude’s biting, bawdy and brilliant Covid-age fable.
des_facet: Bad Luck Banging or Loony Porn (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Katia Pascariu as Emi in “Bad Luck Banging or Loony Porn,” from the Romanian director Radu Jude.

results.title: Inside Jane Campion’s Cinema of Tenderness and Brutality
results.abstract: In “The Power of the Dog,” her first movie in 12 years, the filmmaker ventures into the American West — and the inner worlds of cruel, complicated men.

multimedia.caption: Everything about Jane Campion indicates what she is: the most decorated female filmmaker alive.
multimedia.copyright: Ruven Afanador for The New York Times

results.title: ‘India Sweets and Spices’ Review: Gossip, Secrets and Biting Laughs
results.abstract: A party invitation exposes a family and a community in this Geeta Malik feature starring Sophia Ali.

multimedia.caption: Sophia Ali, left, and Anita Kalathara in “India Sweets and Spices.”

results.title: ‘The Princess Switch 3’ Review: Meow, It’s Fiona’s Turn
results.abstract: A golden star on loan from the Vatican to crown the holiday tree in tiny Montenaro has been stolen. What’s a royal family to do?
des_facet: The Princess Switch 3: Romancing the Star (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Vanessa Hudgens as Fiona, being walked by a canine friend in “The Princess Switch 3: Romancing the Star,” on Netflix.

results.title: The Real Surprise of ‘Passing’: A Focus on Black Women’s Inner Lives
results.abstract: By making the lesbian attraction between the main characters more explicit, the drama moves beyond mainstream Hollywood’s white gaze.

multimedia.caption: Ruth Negga, left, and Tessa Thompson in “Passing.”

results.title: With ‘New York Ninja,’ Lights, Camera and, Finally, Action
results.abstract: The 1984 kung fu film was shot, but it wasn’t completed. Now, with a new director and newly recorded dialogue, the film sees the light of day.

multimedia.caption: John Liu, center, in a scene from “New York Ninja.”

results.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a Polish procedural, a Kazakh dark comedy, a Tunisian social-realist drama, and more.

multimedia.caption: Vidya Balan, right, in “Sherni.”

results.title: She Plays a Young Serena Williams
results.abstract: Demi Singleton stars in “King Richard,” opposite Will Smith.

multimedia.caption: Demi Singleton got her acting start on Broadway, performing in “School of Rock.”
multimedia.copyright: Bethany Mollenkof for The New York Times

results.title: The company that produced ‘Parasite’ has bought Endeavor’s scripted content arm.
results.abstract: Endeavor was forced to reduce its ownership stake in its scripted content business as a result of a settlement with the Writers Guild of America.

multimedia.caption: Miky Lee, bottom right, at the 2020 Academy Awards ceremony. Ms. Lee, the vice chair of CJ Entertainment, has been nudging the South Korean company to expand its foothold in Hollywood.
multimedia.copyright: Noel West for The New York Times

results.title: Wilbur Smith, Best-Selling Author of Swashbuckling Novels, Dies at 88
results.abstract: His books were full of lovers, dysfunctional families, pirates and hunters, and set in locations from ancient Egypt to colonial Africa. They sold in the millions.
des_facet: On Leopard Rock: A Life of Adventures (Book)

multimedia.caption: “I wrote,” Mr. Smith said, “about hunting and gold mining and carousing and women.”

results.title: ‘The First Wave’ Review: How to Fight a Virus
results.abstract: The documentary tracks the first four months of the novel coronavirus in March 2020, as it overwhelms works at a hospital in Queens.

multimedia.caption: “The First Wave” centers on the pandemic’s early days inside the Long Island Jewish Medical Center in Queens.

results.title: ‘Zeros and Ones’ Review: Plague and Paranoia
results.abstract: Abel Ferrara’s lockdown experiment is a spooky political thriller with a double dose of Ethan Hawke.

multimedia.caption: Ethan Hawke in “Zeros and Ones.”

results.title: ‘Procession’ Review: Art as Exorcism
results.abstract: In this experimental documentary streaming on Netflix, six survivors of abuse within the Catholic Church use filmmaking to confront traumatic memories.

multimedia.caption: From left, Ed Gavagan, Michael Sandridge and Dan Laurine in the documentary “Procession.”

results.title: ‘Black Friday’ Review: Killer Sales Bring Killer Customers
results.abstract: In this horror-comedy, a group of resentful retail workers struggle to survive as shoppers overtaking their toy store are ravaged by a zombie plague.

multimedia.caption: Devon Sawa in “Black Friday.”

results.title: ‘Out of the Blue’: When Dennis Hopper Cast Himself as a Dad
results.abstract: As the director and star, Hopper delivered some wildly self-indulgent moments. But it’s Linda Manz, playing a troubled teenage girl, who stole the show.

multimedia.caption: Dennis Hopper as the slightly unhinged father of Linda Manz in “Out of the Blue.”

results.title: Script Supervisor Sues Alec Baldwin and Others in ‘Rust’ Shooting
results.abstract: A lawsuit filed by the supervisor, Mamie Mitchell, said an injury or death on the set was “a likely result” of the production’s failure to follow safety protocols.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

multimedia.caption: A second lawsuit was filed in the fatal shooting of a cinematographer on the set of the Alec Baldwin film “Rust.”

results.title: Miramax Sues Quentin Tarantino Over Planned ‘Pulp Fiction’ NFTs
results.abstract: The director announced this month that he was selling nonfungible tokens based on the screenplay for his 1994 movie. Miramax asserted in court documents it still has “broad rights” to the film.

multimedia.caption: The director Quentin Tarantino announced the sale of “Pulp Fiction” nonfungible tokens at a crypto-art event in New York earlier this month.

results.title: ‘Prayers for the Stolen’ Review: Coming of Age Among the Poppies
results.abstract: Tatiana Huezo’s feature film is based on a novel about girls growing up in Mexico in communities terrorized by opium cartels.

multimedia.caption: Marya Membreño, center, as one of the girls who give up their long hair in order to deflect attention from predatory cartel members, in “Prayers for the Stolen,” directed by Tatiana Huezo.

results.title: Join the Comedian Michelle Buteau at a Times Event on the ‘Joys’ of Parenting
results.abstract: Kick back and laugh about the trials and triumphs of raising tiny humans, with the comedian Michelle Buteau and Jessica Grose of The Times’s parenting newsletter at a virtual event on Dec. 8.

results.title: ‘Aulcie’ Review: Love and Basketball, in Israel
results.abstract: This melodramatic documentary chronicles how Aulcie Perry, a basketball center from New Jersey, became a celebrity in Israel after he joined the Maccabi Tel Aviv team.

multimedia.caption: Aulcie Perry, the subject of the documentary “Aulcie.”

results.title: ‘A Choice of Weapons: Inspired by Gordon Parks’ Review: Defining Portraits
results.abstract: This documentary celebrates how the work of the great photographer Gordon Parks brought a nuanced fidelity to Black experience.
des_facet: A Choice of Weapons: Inspired by Gordon Parks (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The photographer Gordon Parks.
multimedia.copyright: Gordon Parks/The Gordon Parks Foundation, via HBO

results.title: Jeanna de Waal Has Already Forgotten About That ‘Diana’ Film
results.abstract: The Netflix version of Broadway’s “Diana, the Musical” landed with a thud. But it got people talking. Now the show’s lead actress is staying positive ahead of opening night.

multimedia.caption: “Look, we didn’t film this for Netflix because we thought it was bad,” Jeanna de Waal said of the special. “We thought it was fantastic.”
multimedia.copyright: Josefina Santos for The New York Times

results.title: Hollywood crew union narrowly ratifies its contracts with studios.
results.abstract: The margin was perilously narrow, with many International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees members viewing the pact as toothless in terms of preventing long working hours.
org_facet: International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees

multimedia.caption: IATSE members prepared for a strike before negotiators reached tentative agreements with film and television studios.
multimedia.copyright: Jenna Schoenefeld for The New York Times

results.title: The Great High-Fashion Family Film Experiment
results.abstract: The Rodarte designers on creating costumes for the sequel to the animated film “Sing.”

multimedia.caption: A still from “Sing 2,” with costumes designed by Rodarte.

results.title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include mutants in love and mushrooms out for blood.
des_facet: Horror Noire: A History of Black Horror (Movie)
Nobody Sleeps in the Woods Tonight 2 (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Eric Tabach in “Dashcam.”

results.title: Watch Kristen Stewart Embody Princess Diana in ‘Spencer’
results.abstract: The director Pablo Larraín narrates a sequence from his film.

results.title: ‘What Do We See When We Look at the Sky?’ Review: But I Digress
results.abstract: Two strangers become near-lovers in a movie that invites you to think more about the perfectly, simply, ordinary life around them.
des_facet: What Do We See When We Look at the Sky? (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Ani Karseladze in “What Do We See When We Look at the Sky?,” directed by Alexandre Koberidze.

results.title: ‘Cusp’ Review: Teenage Girls, Stuck With Shrugging Off Harm
results.abstract: What starts as a documentary about three Texan high schoolers becomes a look at the normalization of sexual abuse.

multimedia.caption: The documentary “Cusp” focuses on three teenage girls in Texas.
